About WB Analytics

WB Games is a leader in the games industry across all game platforms and mobile devices. From Mortal Kombat, Game of Thrones, and Batman to Harry Potter, and LEGO, our storytelling and unique player experiences reach millions of gamers across the world.

Our diverse and inclusive workforce creates and brings to life the most beloved characters, franchises, heroes, and wizards in the world.

We are fans of what we make and proud of what we do.

Our WB Analytics team supports our studios and publishing teams worldwide, throughout the lifecycle of each game. We work closely with these partners to continuously refine:
- Our Analytics Platform
- Market Research
- Game Analytics
- Publishing Analytics

Our WBA team has openings worldwide, as well as embedded positions at each studio. Many positions have flexible location options.



Self Advancement & Promotion
WBA is very supportive of both personal enrichment, through training and conferences, as well as supporting personal promotion, through sponsored speaking engagements.

Extremely high retention
WBA has a seasoned team, with a very high retention rate year-over-year. Most members of our team have worked on multiple console generations, and have drawn experience across a wide range of industries.

Advanced Analytics in the Cloud
We have a very close relationship with many Big Data organizations, including Looker, AWS, and the Apache Software Foundation.

In partnership with these organizations, we regularly work ahead of our contemporaries on pre-release features that change the advertising and technology landscape.

Variety
Our team supports a deep cut of the games business that it enables us to regularly cycle everyone through new projects. It’s a great way to see a cross-cut of the games business, and further buff up your experience.

Flexible work arrangements
We want to support you, and that starts with providing an environment where you can do your best work. We have a very flexible “work from home” policy, and if life changes for you down the line, we support remote work for many situations.

Open Roles

PUBLISHING ANALYTICS

Sr. Publishing Analyst

United States - San Francisco, California

The Senior Publishing Analyst will work with business intelligence, analytics and publishing professionals to determine the best approaches and systems for supporting state-of-the-art analytics; they must have an affinity for data and analytics that support key business decisions. The Senior Publishing Analyst will work closely with the Mobile games team, User Acquisitions, Central Product Managers, and other groups to evaluate how our customers are coming to and playing our games and inform improvements we can make to drive sustained engagement and monetization. Specifically, they will be extremely detail oriented, with a strong product orientation and an affinity for data and analytics in support of driving both product-level and business decisions. The successful candidate thrives at delivering solutions to complex data problems preferably in gaming, and has proven themselves effective at navigating and overcoming both internal and external challenges. Apply.

Marketing Analytics Graduate Student Intern - Summer 2019

United States - Burbank, California

WB Games is looking for a highly motivated MBA or graduate student intern in the Consumer Insights and Marketing Analytics team who will be responsible for developing and tracking all key business metrics (awareness, purchase intent, sales, retention) and facilitate consistent measurement and data reporting processes across multiple campaigns. They will analyze, collect, and interpret results from an array of data sources to drive businnes decisions; report on digital media campaign KPIs to benchmark paid media efforts; report on player patterns and advise changes to messaging using in-game BI telemetry; coordinate statistical analysis and modeling and ensure the integration of those tools into the marketing programs; and as required, perform hands-on analysis in support of results analysis. Apply.

Marketing Analyst (Temp)

United States - San Francisco, California

WB Games San Francisco is seeking a Marketing Analyst (Temp) to help develop advertising, explore ideas, and help to drive conversion optimization for some of the biggest IPs. They will develop advertising for some of the biggest IP's; explore and validate new test ideas; and drive the conversation around conversion optimization.

(Relocation assistance will not be provided for this role.) Apply.

Senior Analyst, CRM Operations (Temporary)

United States - Needham, Massachusetts

WB Games is recruiting a Senior CRM Analyst to help drive cross-functional publishing efforts on behalf of our mobile games in the Lifecycle group, part of the Mobile Publishing team. The role’s focus and primary responsibilities revolve around CRM campaign management as well as building analysis, data integrations and related capabilities that enable the iterative improvement of tailored CRM campaigns to player cohorts across our game portfolio. The ideal candidate is a master of all things data, with a keen interest in leveraging analysis and data integration to enable the most cutting-edge email marketing and related direct-digital capabilities to date. Apply.

Analyst, Sales Planning - WB Interactive Entertainment

United States - Burbank, California

Warner Bros. Interactive Entertainment seeks an Analyst, Sales Planning for the Selling department. They will be a part of dedicated supply chain support for partner titles (Cyberpunk, Rocket League, Fortnite); work as part of Digital Sales Support to provide supporting analyses for digital sales team with key insights and recommendations to support sales and marketing; ensure alignment amongst operations, order management, marketing, and sales regarding timing and forecasts for new releases; manage the Salesforce forecasting system; and provide ad-hoc reporting. Apply.

ANALYTICS PLATFORM

Senior Analytics QA Engineer - Warner Bros

United States - Boston, Massachusetts

The Warner Bros. Analytics (WBA) team based in Boston MA in the United States are looking to fill a Senior Analytics QA Engineer position which will be based at Playdemic in Wilmslow, UK. The WBA team provides data analytic services to support game teams and analysts across the WB Games organisation and is co-located at the WB Boston studio. The data collected by the analytics platform in real-time is then used to provide insights for guiding game development, marketing, and monetisation. We deploy to the Amazon Cloud and a person in this role will develop a deep understanding of the concepts involved with managing resources in AWS. Apache Spark and Kafka are used in the data processing pipeline.

To apply please email a covering letter and CV to Vicky MacMillan, Senior Recruitment & Resourcing Specialist at jobs@t-tales.com

GAME ANALYTICS

Lead Data Analyst

England - London

Rocksteady Studios is looking to add to its family of permanent staff with an exceptionally talented Lead Data Analyst who is ready for the challenge of striving to produce a world-class AAA title. We are looking for someone who is an expert in building models and analysing large sets of data to create visualisations then communicating these efficiently to our development team such that they make more insightful decisions that improve the overall quality of our game on a day-by-day basis. Apply.

Senior User Researcher

England - London

Rocksteady Studios is looking to add to its family of permanent staff. We are looking for an exceptionally talented Senior User Researcher who is ready for the challenge of producing a world-class, AAA title.

The goal of the User Researcher is to support and enable the developers’ vision by empowering them with actionable insights about our players. At Rocksteady you will apply your passion for understanding and evaluating the player experience in order to assist the design and production teams you are embedded in to make data-informed decisions and ultimately make the greatest possible games. Apply.

Game Data Analyst, Monetization

United States - Chicago, Illinois

NetherRealm Studios, a division of WB Games is looking to add an enthusiastic, talented, and experienced professional with a passion for understanding users’ behavior through data. In collaboration with our existing Analytics Department, the Analyst will work closely with the development teams for the full lifecycles of our products. This position requires excellent project management, communication, and documentation skills. The ideal candidate will demonstrate passion for discovering interesting facts through data and sharing them with others. Daily tasks include gathering requirements from project stakeholders, drafting schemas and tables, working with the ETL and reporting process, and developing documentation. Apply.
